caption: At the first moment  you come to this restaurant  the personel give you a great feeling. Very warm stuff, it is a lovely restaurant to hang out with friends and colleagues or with your date. delicious  cooking, professional  chef, good  cost and attentive  service. Highly recommended.

We came here to celebrate my wife's birthday. Walked upstairs to the dining area and we're we quickly seated. The restaurant was half full and the interior was beautifully designed and decorated. The customer service was also outstanding which made the night even better. Our server was very attentive and helpful through  the evening.  We started off with a couple of drinks. Some sangria and a Pina de mi ojo. Both were pricey. As for the food, it was definitely pricey as well, with some dishes that stood out and some that weren't tasty at all.  Datiles con almendras: The best tapa of the night unfortunately came first. Bacon wrapped dates with marcona almonds topped with la peral fondue. A sweet and savory dish with an interesting touch and the end of the bite when you bite into an almond. $10  Pan con tomate: I read a lot of reviews comparing this to bruschetta. There is no comparison. Bruschetta usually is full of flavor. This however was just tomato's spread on top of crispy sourdough that wasn't very crispy. Could barely taste any olive oil. $7  Gambas de ajillo: This tapa was actually quite tasty. Shrimp in garlic, shrimp and birds eye chili that gave it a nice kick. $14  Patatas bravas; I've had better but these weren't bad. Just a little plain. Just potatoes covered in salsa brava, garlic aioli and chili oil. $9  Canelons de sant esteve con jarrete de buey: short rib filled cannelloni, with farm chicken foie Gras, and creamy truffle bechamel. This one sounded good but tasted to gamey. The cannelloni also added a weird slimy texture that was unappetizing. $15  Bunuelos Del ampurdan: You get three fried beignets with lemon cream and salted butter sauce. These weren't bad but coulld have used about triple the amount the say us they provides us with. $10  Overall, it was a great night and lovely dinner, but at the end of day, there's better tasting tapas in the city, and for a lot less. I wouldn't completely leave Mercat off the list, but probably wouldn't return anytime in the near future.

This is a great Spanish inspired restaurant with tapas d traditional Spanish fare. They have a great lunch time deal that is pretty quick, affordable and delicious!!  I spot here every time I’m in town.
Delicious food.

Had a great time at dinner! I stumbled into Mercat because I was attending the Alvin Alley show. Actually it was drinks, turned into apps which turned into dinner and more then more drinks. The food and drinks were impeccable. Fresh, hot food. Drinks were tasty. Strong but not overbearing. My favorite interaction was with the host. Think his name was Tyrone. Very polite and smiling. I’ll definitely be back
Went for breakfast, was fantastic
Great place and food.

My most demanding and critical friend from NYC was in town and she was blown away by everything at "Mercat", especially the ambiance and cuisine . She often travels throughout  Spain/Catalan for business and pleasure and she heartily approved of the paella, tapas and Spanish wines. Memorable stand outs were the bacon wrapped dates and the arros del senyoret paella. On a personal note, this was my first time back to the restaurant after a 5 year hiatus and I was as just as impressed as I was on my first visit about 15 years ago.
Best "ropa veja" I've had in my life so far.
Great spanish food!
Service = good Food = lacks flavor, not to the level expected from a place like this Ambiance = pleasant  Background: ordered 4 dishes. 2 of them were OK and the other 2 were 👎🏽. Really really bad.

Thursday night visiting Chicago. The tasting menu was a great solution to our tapas dilemmas. A fantastic selection of Spanish wines which provided a good pull from Rioja. Everything came out great. The paella was a lot to take in after the delicious courses before. The bacon wrapped dates were a highlight and a pleasant surprise in flan with poached pears and cinnamon ice cream as the chef’s dessert. Highly recommend.
Best Spanish tapas in Chicago with a really classy atmosphere. I am from Barcelona and I feel at home here.
A good experience. Good food. Fun ambience. Professional Staff. Thank you.
I loved it. Paella was enough for two to three. This may be a new Chicago favorite for me.

At the first moment  you enter this restaurant  the waiters give you a comfortable feeling. Very congenial stuff, it is a nice place to  enjoy with your friends or with your date. yummy  food, qualified  chef de cuisine, comfortable  cost and nice  service. Warmly recommended.
Absolutley lovely! Wonderful food and staff! Great to order several dishes and share amongst a group of people.
Waiter brought my wife out birthday cake on the house. It was unexpected and very kind. A little pricey, but still neat.
Rico
Nice place for a group dinner but the staff is rude if you come late at the night.

Amazing experience. Very knowledgeable and friendly server who graciously accommodated some dietary restrictions at the table by recommending specific dishes and allowing sauces on the side, etc. Everything was awesome, but if you can't decide, go with the chef's tasting menu. You won't be disappointed.

Omg!! I'm from Barcelona, and been looking for a spanish restaurant that could match my expectations out of Spain..my girlfriend took me to this catalan influenced restaurant..and I went back to my country! I would visit Chicago again just for this restaurant, food is a good as you find it back in Spain!
Had 3 items on the tapas menu. While the food was flavorful, overall the dishes were all very salty
Carlos @ the bar. Octupus is the dish of the decade.
Beautiful atmosphere. Great food.
Good tapas as always. Specialty cocktails very slow to prepare.
Great brunch
Excellent food but absurdly small serving sizes.
Excellent Spanish restaurant with very tasty dishes and superb service
“Mercat” might mean “market” in Catalan, but to me it means “tasty.”  EVERY small plate we had was delicious. Even if you’ve had plenty of bacon-wrapped dates, you need to try these.

Beautifully decorated. We came in to have some drinks and snacks from the bar area since dinner service hadn't started yet. Staff was unhelpful, and borderline rude, so we ended up leaving. A shame since we were looking forward to trying a lot of dishes when dinner started.

Came and tried out their tasting menu. Most tasting menus I try, attempt to give guest a unique experience by combining flavors and experimenting with ingredients that don’t normally go together. It’s always an interesting experience but sometimes some dishes are more interesting then they are good. At Mercat a la Planxa they don’t go that direction and instead their tasting menu is a greatest hits of their tapas. This results in a delicious and memorable dinner and at $55 per person also one of the cheapest tasting menus I’ve ever done. The cocktails were also very good/strong and made a good companion with the dishes. Will come back again!
Amazing food and staff!

I’m spoiled for life by this visit to a tapas restaurant in the historic Blackstone Hotel in Chicago. The service is impeccable; they have a very decent wine list, and you can eat early (6.15 pm) without raising any eyebrows. Highlands of a huge dinner were the cannelloni with short rib filling, the beef and chicken paella, and the hanger steak. Everything else was very nice too.
Food was ok. It was unusual but ok tasting. Definitely overpriced.

After a long day at McCormick convention center, I was whipped. Didn’t feel like walking or wandering the area for a place to dine. Initially went into Mercat for a drink. But after watching plates of Spanish cuisine pass by headed to their tables, we decided to stay and dine at our hotel. Staff was very professional and attentive. Food was delicious and presentable. My only regret is I didn’t get the paella !
Fabulous tapas. Crazy busy at Happy Hour due to its loop location, but it calms down afterward.
Good food, super expensive!
People watching, cocktails, nice ambience.
(Translated by Google) Great service  (Original) Buen servicio
Beautiful location, mediocre food
Food was great and atmosphere was just as great!
Great evening! Food was exquisite, ambiance was perfect; lively and fun! Definitely worth our walk in the cold Chicago  wind! Birthday dessert was on the house!
Tasting menu was great, with a giant plate of paella to close out.
(Translated by Google) Excellent food Atmosphere and attention first  (Original) Comida excelente. Ambientación y atención  de primera
It's like being on vacation.  So much fun to explore!
Excellent Tapas, great service
Delicious
Great food. Nice little spot.

Selected a number of small plates and our group of 4 people enjoyed everything. The plates arrive as they are ready so you don't feel like your table is getting crowded. Also ordered pitchers of Sangria which was was a perfect accompaniment to our tapas. Loved that it was connected to our hotel so we didn't have to put on coats to enjoy a midday meal. The service was very good as we never had to ask for a thing and our Sangria glasses were kept full, and the plates disappeared as we finished our selections.
Exquisite food, terrific service. Every plate was beautiful and flavorful. A very nice place to dine.

After a long day at McCormick convention center, I was whipped. Didn’t feel like walking or wandering the area for a place to dine. Initially went into Mercat for a drink. But after watching plates of Spanish cuisine pass by headed to their tables, we decided to stay and dine at our hotel. Staff was very professional and attentive. Food was delicious and presentable. My only regret is I didn’t get the paella !
Great food and great service!!
Beautiful atmosphere, eclectic dishes
Everything I ate was spectacular.
Best Spanish food I've had since Barcelona.

The tapas was good, but the portions were tiny. The paella was extremely salty and took some work to finish eating. The service was good and the staff is very attentive. Probably a good spot to get a drink or two, but wouldn't recommend for their food.
Great server,  very interesting and tasty food

username: lฮีย หนีlมียมา

caption: ! Everything was simply exceptional! Pride at work.
Its pretty good price  for the food
Fairly authentic and well prepared. Paella had a thin layer of rice and dry like it should be. unlike other Spanish restaurants.

It’s nice to have a great restaurant in the same hotel that your staying in. This place is located in The Blackstone Hotel. If you like Tapas you will love this place. The small plates were big on favor and the service was paced just right. I haven’t had Paella in years so that was a treat! The Paella is served in family style plate so save room.
Highly recommend. Great service, great cocktails and amazing paella.

We had 4 tapas for 2 people and it was just right (maybe even a little more  food than we needed).  The very simple but very delicious Pan con Tomate was perhaps my favorite, we also had a salad with serrano ham (it was great), the Coca de escalivada (it was ok), and the Couscous with vegetables (highly recommend). The drinks were expensive and a little too sweet for my taste. I'd come back..

Located in the classic Blackstone hotel, the airy dining room has relatively decent views of Grant Park. My wife and I did the tasting menu and it delivered enough food for four people. The paella dish alone could feed four people and there were four courses before that!  The service was impeccable to boot.
Great tapas and good drinks. It's outside my normal area for dinners but if I'm in the area I'll be back
Had breakfast there on our last day in the city.  Everything was great.  The roasted breakfast potatoes were prefect. Serving sides were large.
Delicious tapas, good service

Came here on a Saturday at 5:30 pm after a long day walking down Michigan avenue. I accidentally made my reservation for the wrong day, but thankfully the staff was able to accommodate my party. Got a paella, three tapas, and three glasses of sangria for my group of three. Enjoyed the ambiance, was able to get a seat near the window which looked across the street to grant park. Friendly staff, bathroom is in the hotel lobby and very clean. Would recommend if you're ever in Chicago and have a craving for tapas.
Great food and drinks
Best authentic Spanish tapas in town. Don't miss the paella, the pink Sangria and their famous Giin and Tonic!
Tapas good but Paella's average
Great Paella!!!

Terrible food. Tasteless. Awful service! Overall probably the worst restaurant in all of Chicago. On top to charge you $52 for chicken paella! That taste like rubber tasteless chicken that could be served out of a can! If you want tapas stay away from this spot, save your time and money.
The Food was enjoyable ... Slow service ... always room for improvement with the service ...
Traditional Eggs Benedict was prefect. Loved the atomopshere.
Good food , nice decoration, comfortable place and lovely staff.
Had the Serrano ham and fig salad with the scallops a la llauna tapas, and they were a perfect combo. With a glass of sangria, of course.
Best first place evvverrr
Try the tasting menu and tell them I sent you.

If I could give this restaurant 0 stars, I would. I booked a lunch reservation via OpenTable for my mom and I on a Saturday at 1:30 pm.  Pro: Food was delicious... this was the only positive thing I can say about this place.  Cons: 1. We were given the wrong menus when we were seated - it was 1:30 pm on Saturday which is brunch but we were given dinner menus. Our server only realized this once we tried to order food. 2. Slow service! 3. Our table didn’t have silverware, napkins, or salt and pepper. We didn’t realize this until we got our food and we had to flag down someone to get these items. 4. Server who brought food did not offer any butter, jam, or ketchup for our brunch items. We had to ask for this separately. 5. Amount of syrup given for the torrijas brioche French toast was minuscule and we had to ask for more. 6. Our server dropped off our check as we were STILL EATING and we hadn’t even asked. 7. Got an email from OpenTable where I had booked the reservation a few hours later that we were a NO SHOW despite telling the staff that we had a reservation! Now I have to explain that we actually did show up! Work I have to do thanks to the ignorance of the staff. 8. Too costly for what we got.
Great tapas!  Highly recommended along with their special Gin and tonic.
Wonderful food,  service,  view
This is what goes for Spanish in the US. If you've ever been to Spain, it's mediocre.  If you haven't, it's just ok..
Nice place, reasonable food
Best tapas around!

We had no idea what to expect coming in but we were blown away! We did the tasting special plus a few other items and it was more food than we could eat in one sitting so it was our lunch and dinner the next day! Our server was amazing. Everyone was so friendly and polite and helpful. Cannot wait to come back!
Great pallela
Delcious! Worth the price tag

This place is great for a nice dinner or a romantic date. The food was exceptional. I loved the Branzino and eggplant. I want to try every single thing on the menu so I will keep coming back. Service was great. Attentive but not overwhelming. Overall ambiance was perfect.
Great and unique experience. The bacon wrapped dates were delicious.
Excellent atmosphere. Even better Spanish food.
One of our favorites for some incredible tapas.  One huge reason is their ability to provide gluten free options for my wife (celiac).  Food and service are top notch!
(Translated by Google) designer tapas.  (Original) designer tapas.
Great food and atmosphere.
Upscale tapas. Our bartender was surly.
One of my favorite Tapas/share plate restaurants in Chicago! Right there with Girl & the Goat and Purple Pig.
Very tasty tapas style dishes from Catalonia... enjoyed our meal and the service bit the wine was certainly on the expensive side, especially knowing how much it costs in Spain.

Oh boy, if you’re in the town, it’s one of the must visit restaurants. Very nice place with delicious food and professional service. Very much enjoyed my birthday dinner there. Definitely coming back!
I love this restaurant and have visited 3 times over the last 5 years. Food is fun and the service and ambiance is outstanding. Good for those that like to share notes not big eaters.
Delicious treats. Fair pricing.

As a party of 14 we booked a month in advance and was seated ( was told 2 tables would be pushed together) in 2 large booths that had high backs and we couldn't even see other half of our table. We a only had a few hours to be together it we couldn't socialize with our party. Then we thought the Mercat tasting menu was $55.00 for 2, surprise when we got our table of 6 a bill for $498.00. So we won't be going back to this place.
Wonderful food, fun atmosphere, good service, delicious cocktails.
Tapas are fantastic and authentic. Spinach Serrano salad is great if you like a sweet and savory salad combo.
Amazing food.  Loved every bit.

The food was tasty and the service was good.  We got the dates and the breakfast for 2.  I was a bit disappointed by the cleanliness though.  We were seated by the windows and they looked what I can only describe as "sticky".  Also, we were seated next to the waiter station and the paint was peeling off of the decor there.  When I called to make reservations, they had asked if it was a special occasion and I said birthday.  However, when we arrived, they didn't mention anything about our birthday.  I didn't mind, but it was just odd since they had asked.
Great tapas

For the most part, the food was very good (I highly recommend the octopus, steak, and the pan tomate). The bread tasted homemade and rustic - enough to look over the tacky 5$ bread charge. Specialty gin and tonic was excellent. Docking a point because they told us the paella had certain allergens (that we noted at the beginning of the meal) only after it was brought to the table. The paella itself was only ok (it was pretty salty), but we probably would have ordered something else for the table if we knew that our allergic diner could not eat any of the paellas, we chose the one we ordered because it was the only one whose menu listings left out his other allergens. Either way, would not order the paella again even if it was edible to my whole party.

Fun, bright and full of flavor. We tried many different tapas dishes that were delicious. The cannollies were awesome and so were the croquettes. Service was great and our busboy was the most attentive I have ever seen. Highly recommend this place.
Food was wonderful, but take it from an Architect ... this is one of the worst interior decorated rooms I've ever been in.
Very good
Love the small plate concept, fabulous food!
Outstanding food and service!
Amazing food

The bar tender when we first got here was terrible... He didn't greet us, he didn't introduce him self, he plopped down a drink menu and moved along. When I asked for drink recommendations he said, "How about Gin and tonic?" When I said I was looking for something  like a signature drink, he said it is. He was fast and the drinks were good but he was lacking any personality and engagement what so ever. I am not kidding when I say he said no more than 10 words in the hour we sat at the bar waiting for a table drinking almost $100 dollars in drinks. Now the waiter was phenomenal! Great knowledge of the food and helped with our table of 3's decisions. We had the Octopus, Calamari, Sardines, Bacalao, Bacon wrapped figs, Short rib ravioli, wine and desert. I did find a pea sized piece or foil in one dish, but being culinarian's we understood these things happen and didn't demand a discount. They sent out a free Tapas and a round of desert 🍾! Half the food was phenomenal the other I thought was missing some salt, and the beef short rib ravioli was flat... Needed acid and salt. All in all, I would go here again if I had the same waiter but would substitute some other dishes in.

Very good authentic Spanish restaurant inside The Blackstone. Great entrees, and a ton of tapas exactly as you would find in Madrid. Nice wine list, and plenty of beers on tap and by bottle. Priced about right.  No reason to go anywhere else when staying at hotel.
The food is bombalishush!!!!

We have a monthly catered lunch at our company, and this month we ordered from Helmand Palace (1/24/2019).  Based on the glowing Yelp reviews we all were excited to try out the menu.  The expectations we had were met and exceeded.  Everyone loved the food -- in particular the Aushak.  We'd definitely recommend Helmand Palace to others.

Very average food that has the most tenuous of connections to Spain.  The staff while efficient are in different to the customer and what the interior designers have done to this once grand room is beyond forgivable.  The wine list is however rather good.
The octopus was fantastic as were the drinks.  Some of the small plates though are lacking.

Great modern interpretation of tapas and a large selection of paellas (the Fideau, made with thin toasted angel hair pasta is my favorite although some of the monkfish was slightly overcooked and underseadoned last time I got it). Their beverage program is also interesting with some really great Spanish wine options and a ton of sherries.

(Translated by Google) One of the best things about the United States welcoming the avian cannelloni still my daughter reminds me of a hug I'm in Catalonia to Chicago  (Original) Una de les coses mes xules de USA acollonant endevant els canelons de l avía encara la meva filla els recorda una abraçada vaig está a Catalunya a Chicago
A bit overpriced. $20 for 2 ounces of cheese with sorbet and jello for some reason?
Excellent food, no doubt! Sadly the service was incredibly lacking and on many occasions were we waiting for extended periods of time trying to order more food and drinks.
Gorgeous views, excellent service, great food, good wine list, pricey but enjoyed our evening and would do it again!

The service was prompt and friendly. We ordered the tasting menu which gave us different tastes of different things. I always love the shrimp in garlic and the shishito peppers. The ginger beer has a nice bite to it!

Best Catalan restaurant so far in the whole United States!!! Just Amazing! All dishes are or almost exactly like the original recipes of the Catalan cuisine. I have to say that there are other dishes that are not Catalan but from other regions of Spain and they are also extraordinary!!! I would recommend this restaurant without a doubt. If you are home sick... just go... and before swallowing the first bite... you will feel like going back home. Yes! It is that GOOD!!!

Service at the bar was terrible while we waited. The bartender didn't even acknowledge us until we asked a question about drinks, to which his reply was "look at the menu" more or less. Our waiter was great given the circumstances, but two of us found hair in our paella that we were sharing. The manager of the restaurant was notified and came to "apologize" which was more of a "sorry, not really sorry" by saying he "wishes he could tell us hair in the food doesn't happen, but it does. I'll comp the dish." Just apologize and comp the food, no need to try and justify to us your cooks can't keep their hair out of people's food and give a sarcastic apology. The sad part is, the food was actually pretty good but the overall experience was terrible, we won't be back.
Was there for drinks and appetizers. Service was beyond awful. Food was adequate. For the price you pay, I don't recommend. Many better options in the area.

After a great breakfast here, we went for dinner, spoke to the dining supervisor to let him know that we were in a bit of a rush trying to go to the airport and could we do dinner within 30 min. He said no problem, gave up our menus, sat us and told us the waiter would be right over, 10 minutes later I asked the supervisor if we could give him our order since the waiter had not showed, he could not and there was only one waiter. so we decided to sit at the bar, we placed our order, there were some type of delay in brining out the food which was good but we rushed through the meal and got out in 55 minutes. Good food but not a quality experience.

Food is good but overpriced for portion and the esthetic of presentation. Wait staff has quite a bit of attitude and we felt pressured to leave when they turned out the lights at 10:30 despite being open until 11.

Amazing brunch options! We were staying at The Blackstone and didn't feel like venturing out in the snow, so we went here for brunch. The brunch burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. We also got the brioche french toast, which was absolutely delicious. Food came out very quickly and was served hot. Great experience!
Great place. Came here for a birthday.
Unique small plates offer interesting tastes
Food here is amazing.  Dont let its location (in a hotel) fool you...really really good food.
Amazing Catalan food, worth the price. The Decor very aesthetically pleasing !!
Great place for breakfast and brunch. You can get a peaceful view of the park if you get the right seat. Many options to select from. The food was flavorful and well presented.
One of my favorite restaurants in the country.

Excellent tapas style restaurant. Menu selection was limited for me due to a seafood allergy. Unfortunately they do not have a dedicated fryer for non seafood. The meatballs were great and so was the chorizo and cannelloni! Wish they had separate fryer so that i could have tried more items
Delightful Catalan cuisine! Cocktails expertly mixed!!!
Delicious

Worst customer service. Michael (manager) is the worst. We walk in and didn't make us welcomed. First line " we closing at ... And kitchen is closing at ... " The 2 tables that came in after us didn't get that welcomed

The salade verde was not typical....in a good way.  It was fresh and inventive.  The tuna tartare flat bread was outstanding....I have never had anything like it.  Both were recommended by the server and I am grateful.  This is a hidden gem.
The bacon wrapped dates were the bet thing I've ever had!.
Lovely mood life music, great service !
The service was great the food was phenomenal.  We tried so many different items the tapas items had full flavor and just great, but the Ribeye steak tender, flavor, and cooked to perfection.

The service was mediocre, although the bartender was super friendly. Cocktails were ok enough. Food was ok, but not mind blowing. Although the little tuna tacos made from a root veggie were creative. Was hoping for a bit more.

I liked the decor and the service.  The food is alright for its price.  I think the lamb chops with the red pepper sauce is great.  The other tapas were fine but the shrimp was a bit heavy on salt.  Nice for a date.
Would not go back.  Limited menu.  Poor service.  Pricey.  Bad attitudes.
Pretty good drinks, really good food, only four star because the menu isn't super extensive, and it's decently pricy
Great atmosphere to lounge, and to visit.  Seperate walk in Bar as well streetside, but dinng was a pleasure.  Great service, and amazing attitude on a holiday month.
Great place with great food and atmosphere.
Everything was delicious, but their bacon wrapped dates are exceptional
Spanish breakfast for 2 is a thumbs up!

LOVE the ambiance & the service was on par, but personally for me, the food was underwhelming & overpriced. The patatas bravas are described as spicy and flavorful, but I found them quite bland and mostly just salty. The traditional artisanal cheese platter had great cheese, but the accompanying condiments were subpar (mostly sour). My boyfriend loved his calamari though so maybe the meat dishes are better! Overall, we got two drinks and three tapas plates with a total of $80+ including tip, which is quite pricey in comparison to taste and service. Worth checking out at least once for the ambiance though!

My husband and I went here while visiting on our babymoon (vacation before baby is born) last year in 2017. This place is fantastic! It is so good, we talk about it frequently and will visit Chicago again... even if it's just to go back to this restaurant. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was great.
The best restaurant I've ever eaten at my life. Food is amazing
Excellent breakfast option. Try the roasted carrot and couscous
Cozy place. Quite expensive thou. The Jamon iberico doesn't  taste the same as the one back in Spain.
Unique menu selection and like the family style serving shortage.  Great way to enjoy an evening with colleagues or friends while sampling different dishes and drinks.  Enjoyed the Sangria, too.
Good service food great

I give this review with regret. Was hear a few years ago and it was great. This time... Service was horrible. Kept waiting, giving benefit of the doubt. Wanted food so bad, but by the time we actually got drinks and service, we left... Very disappointed.
(Translated by Google) Ham ham  (Original) Prosciutto prosciutto
Good service, good atmosphere , good croquetas, the black ink paella is amazing!
Food has gone downhill.  Too many dishes were overly salty.
Awesome place!!!

Claudia is absolutely wonderful. Great food and service. Chef Diego was very friendly and came out to greet and chat with us. Our favorite place to visit when we come to Chicago and the Blackstone is one of our favorite hotels to stay in.
Not that great for brunch..
It's a good place to eat. It's Spanish but not really Mexican food
Had breakfast in this hotel restaurant.  Very limited menu and mediocre food for breakfast.  Heard it is a good reputation for dinner.
after all these years,  still delicious.
Great service, good food
Wonderful food.
Expensive restaurant but amazing good
Very good but not very clear about what is in the food...
Not bad - kind of pricey.
Very unique menu, skilled bartenders, very relaxed and helpful staff!

Not bad for a US "spanish" restaurant We were curious about how "spanish" the Mercat would be. We went for dinner there, and asked an assortment of different tapas. The outcome was somewhat mixed. The pimientos padron was not really up to the level, the batatas bravas were interesting (both on the picture), while the setas al horno and the croquetas de jamon were good, and could be offered in Spain without loosing face. Service was competent, but not more than that. Overall, we could return there if in a rush to eat spanish - total cost per person was around 40 US$ (with bier). The view on the park is nice - if you are on the right place in the restaurant, so do not count on it necessarily.
Food was amazing scallops 😍😍
It was like being in Barcelona. Wonderful selection of tapas.
Great food and drinks all day long, from classics like eggs Benedict or burgers, to tapas and paella, with creative cocktails, sangria, and good beers.
I expected something better the food it's not good.
Paella and Tapas we're all excellent

This place is truly deserves five stars. The server was extremely knowledgeable and had some great recommendations for us. It is located inside of a hotel so finding it was a bit of a struggle but once we did we were in an elevator on our way up to the restaurant. The Decour is absolutely beautiful, The hints of color in the dining room really stand out and I can tell were strategically placed to be appealing to the eyes. We ordered a pitcher of sangria to share which was strong but good. I ordered two things: green salad with cheese along with meat balls  that had Yogurt and I was very content at the end. The bread went perfectly with everything served at the table which is the way it should be. Everything everyone else ordered was good also and I can’t wait to go back. This place is DEF a gem.
(Translated by Google) Good place to taste Spanish dishes  (Original) Buen sitio para degustar platos españoles
Nice brunch menu
Food was unique and savory
An eating experience not to be missed even by the luckiest of eaters.
Great tapas and atmosphere
Terrific Spanish tapas restaurant in Chicago. Great friendly service and nice atmosphere.

We arrived between services so ordered from a small selection of choices. We got the patatas bravas and the pan con tomaquet. The paprika sauce on the patatas bravas was excellent but the potatoes themselves were unexceptional.  The bread with tomato was just that. The bread was good but the tomato topping was unremarkable.

The foods they serve here are so overwhelming and mouthwatering. They are very delicious and prepared very nice in a very timely manner. The one I ate most was the scallops and even ordered for 2 of that same dish for myself but the over dishes are also delicious it's just that I surely love scallops. You lots should give this restaurant a try and for sure you'll love it too.

Really loved Mercat from the moment we entered through the lobby of the hotel until we stumbled out via a tapas coma.  Our server was very good and fed our table of 4 about 10 things that were absolutely delicious.  We opted for the secret special which was a fantastic cut of pork that was oh so tender.  Plan on spending $60-80 PP but there is a ton of value here.
Great food and service.

One of the hidden gems of the city! If you are visiting Chicago and find yourself around millennium/grant park, stop in and grab a margarita and some grub. You will not be be disappointed. Our bartender Luis was full of insight and really mde our visit special! 10/10 will come back again!

Went for brunch. The food was okay, but the eggs were over poached. Giving it three stars as I expected more from a place that is connected to Jose Garces. I also thought that the restaurant could've been better maintained as there was a lot of food on the ground and many tables had yet to be wiped down even though it was a slower time.
Fantastic food and wine choices and fabulous service.  Located inside the iconic Blackstone hotel and beautifully appointed.  Great atmosphere.
Hands down the best restaurant I've ever been to - our company exhibits at IRCE every year and this is a guaranteed perfect meal every time
Great place for tapas in the loop. I would highly recommend the fig and prosciutto salad.
Great service and excellent food !Good ambiance and really nice view.
Every dish we ordered was nicely presented and rich with flavor.  The cocktails and coffee were very enjoyable and the friendly service rounded out a great dinner.

This is the one spot we eat at every year when we visit Chicago for the Blues Festival. Friendly, efficient, professional service complements exquisite tapas selections that are beyond good. Roasted peppers, white anchovies, cheese and meat platters paired with excellent wine choices make for authentic meal. Desserts should be given consideration also.
Beautiful restaurant with beautiful views of the park across the street and delicious food.
Best tapas that I've ever had. Make sure you can afford it before you make reservations.
Delicious food. Vegan options too!
Wow, this a great little place in an old hotel. We really enjoyed our dinner. Got the pork shoulder! It was spectacular and learned about a new sauce. You have to go there and find out!
Pricy but delicious tapas.

I loved Mercat a la Planxa! Its really nice Spanish tapas and actually from Spain (I know that seems normal for that but a lot of restaurants have Latin America food)! I would highly recommend the tasting menu, its really good! The staff …
Bland and overpriced, especially the tasting menu
A real treasure in Chicago dining, a must after the ballet located in a beautifully renovated old Chicago Hotel.
Honestly, I loved their tapas and then found out they serve breakfast! Everything on the menu is quality and the staff is super helpful and polite. The arrós breakfast is amazing!!!
Nice ambience, good location, and good food.
AWESOME service. The sangria was tasty and food perfect
Within 3 days in Chicago we arrived twice. One night for a drink and the other for dinner. Food was delicious. Service was excellent.
Excellent catalan food
Great breakfast!
Great atmosphere, the room itself is a sight.  The bar is inviting.  Food was great, interesting eclectic menu, tapas style food.  I would go again!!

Sat at the bar one evening after a conference, the waiter was friendly and the food was perfect.   Do not let the menu intimate you.. We had the following tapas:  XORIÇO (smoked garlic-sausage), GAMBAS AL AJILLO (garlic shrimp skewers), DATILES CON ALMENDRAS (Bacon wrapped dates) and VIEIRAS (scallops). it was all so great!!
Excellent. Food was exceptional !! Such a great dining experience. All of our servers were wonderful especially Samuel! Our view out to the park was great!

We visited for Sunday lunch. Nice ambience, very (kid-)friendly and attentive staff. The Tapas selection is on the smaller side. Unfortunately, they were out of at least 3 of the most interestingly sounding  (meat/seafood) Tapas, which left us with mostly vegetarian dishes to choose. We were surprised since it was a slow day with maybe 5-6 tables being occupied. The Tapas tasted soso, and the ingredients didn't shine. Most sauces were either too bland, others were laden with Cayenne or red pepper powder, meaning they were just spicy without any additional complexity in the heat or flavor. The portion size of the Tapas was too large. A single person probably won't be able to have more than 3 Tapas. Expect to rack up a rather substantial bill, since many Tapas cost more than $10. Alcoholic beverages are also quite expensive. E.g., a Sangria is $12...

Wonderful retro surroundings.  Every dish had amazing presentation. Portions seemed small, but it is tapas after all, so drinks and dinner for two was about right at $100.  They were not that busy the Tuesday we visited, but the bar tender was slow. The waiter became more attentive after I complained about a protracted wait for a simple glass of wine. I would go again to give them a second chance.
Atmosphere and service were great. Food was ok. We would go back to try the paella. I recommend not getting the octopus, I have had much better.

The food was good, and the service was great.  There was an awkward moment, when getting off the elevator, because there wasn't a clear indication of where we should go from there, nor was anyone there to greet guests.  The cocktails are imaginative and well made, the tasting menu option (restaurant week or their standard versions) are absolutely the way to go.
Delicious brunch! Loved it!

Service was outstanding, especially the bartender who tended to customers during lounge hour, he was great. The drink I had was well made and very good. Some of the food was excellent, some it just okay. The bacon wrapped dates were great and the sauce they were served with was a  highlight of my meal. I also ordered octopus which was tough (which for octopus can be somewhat forgiven) but it also had little flavor and what flavor was there was mostly salt; I found it disappointing. The salad I was served because it was made in error and the kitchen didn't want to throw it out was good, with crunchy walnuts and salty bacon lardons and bleu cheese and a sherry shallot viniagrette that was really good. Unfortunately the bleu cheese was overpowering and made the whole salad very strong and salty, but not inedible by any means. I'd return to try other options on the menu for the great ambiance, drinks, and service, and would definitely have the dates again while there.
It was good but more pricey then it was worth.

(Translated by Google) Definitely one of the best Spanish restaurants I have been to, the food is of a superior quality, all the tapas are delicious, the decoration of the place is in very good taste and the price is in proportion to the quality of the food, definitely It is not cheap but it is worth visiting if you are in Chicago.  (Original) Definitivamente uno de los mejores restaurantes españoles en los que he estado, la comida es de una calidad superior, todas las tapas son riquisimas, la decoracion del lugar es de muy buen gusto y el precio esta en proporcio a la calidad de la comida, definitivamente no es economico pero vale la pena visitarlos si es que estas en chicago.

(Translated by Google) Definitely one of the best restaurants I've been to, all the tapas are delicious, the price is in proportion to the quality of the products, the decoration and setting of the place is the best. Definitely if you are in Chicago do not hesitate to visit it.  (Original) Definitivamente un de los mejores restaurantes en los que he estado, todas las tapas son riquisimas, precio esta en proporcion a la calidad los productos, la decoracion y ambientacion del lugar es lo mejor. Definitivamente si estan en chicago no dudes en visitarlo.

Best pizza taste ever! May take long, but totally worth it. They give you the option to order your food while you are waiting, which could save you about half an hour if you are in a rush. Very friendly and helpful staff, plus a warm and enjoyable environment. The suggested servings are real BTW! If it's your first time, do not miss the classic and Lou deep dish.

Fabulous tapas & drinks! Service is friendly and thoughtful, dining room has a nice, modern ambience, sangria is delicious, tapas timed properly so that food is always rotating, and the food is always so tasty! I only eat the fish and vegetarian dishes, but highly recommend the restaurant--it's outstanding!

I had a reservation for christmas eve at 9 pm.  I arrived at 9:15,  they didn't let me eat there  because they said that the Last reservation they had was at 8:45. we had to go back to our hotel and have dinner there.
Loved it.  Service was excellent all around.  Food did not disappoint.  Fantastic Sangria
Nice atmosphere but the food needed a little more flavor.
5* service, exquisite dishes, comes in my top 5 best restaurant places.
The food is really good! We went for Thanksgiving dinner and we were not disappointed.
Awesome food. Quality. Good service. A place I highly recommend.
Great food and super strong sangria!
Hours posted not correct.  Door locked when I tried to get breakfast at 8:30 on Saturday

Friendly knowledgeable and efficient waitstaff. Both great food and wine that's worth the price.Probably the best tapas in the city. We had the tasting menu for both of us with wine included. The only problem was that the large paella pan …
Food was delicious and coffee was excellent and strong.
Good food and drinks, service ok
The food was awesome and the drinks were even better! The bartender Claudia is the best!
Nice meal, decor and location

Stayed at the hotel and wandered down for some dinner. OMG, it was awesome and memorable. Bacon wrapped dates, octopus, a flatbread thing. Seriously it was perfect. Sit in the attached bar, less people, same great food.
Spot on Tapas! The menu is Rich with opportunities to explore fine cured meats, Rich cheese, dried fruit, and cheese selections. The staff - kind and first rate.
Everything was top notched!  Food, drinks and service!  We will be back!
The new menu looks great & the new remodeled restaurant makes it feel different also the views are fantastic just like food ... Only minor its a bit expensive but worth it.
This place is outstanding! Our server,  Jenn, was very accommodating. The Verde salad, scallops, and Ribeye were delicious. Highly recommend!:

We went to Mericat based off of some of the reviews here. Our experience here was atrocious, and I encourage you to spend your money elsewhere.  Our server that night was Dante. His pre-memorized speech about the menu was not only long, but …
My dining experience was excellent. The best steak and meal I have eaten in the US. I look forward to my next trip to Chicago to eat here again!!
Great tapas and solid sangria. Did the tasting menu and we were stuffed.
Restaurant serving Spanish fares and tapas
It's the best!

Good stuff. The main restaurant was under some form of construction when we stopped, so it was just the basement bar open. But the food selection was still really good. Service was quick, which was great, because we were on our way to a movie.
Absolutely phenomenal. You simply must order the bacon wrapped dates and the octopus. Trust your waiter and the wine selection is terrific. Great service great location. Ask for a seat by the window.
Wonderful.  Thanks Alex.
Great place, food and service
Mediocre food.
Great food and wonderful service!
(Translated by Google) Wonderful food  (Original) Comida maravilhosa
solidly good, not great.   Everything was on the salty side.
Really very very good. Ambience, service and comprehensive menu. Something for everyone and a great wine list too. Recommend the bacon wrapped dates.
Breakfast was great but the service was super slow. May have been a staffing issue.
Food was delicious and, from what i heard, authentic.
(Translated by Google) Great  (Original) Excelente
This is a great place to eat, drink, and people watch!

Overpriced and inauthentic Spanish food.  The tortilla española was tiny and tasteless.  Go to Cafe Ibérico or Ba-ba-ree-ba for real Spanish food.  The service was very good and the place looks really nice but it's not worth the price.
A good Spanish restaurant in an interesting space.  Wouldn't go there for brunch which was average. Try it a dinner

1st, it's located in a historic like hotel. Renaissance Blackstone on Michigan ave. I made the mistake of entering on the lower level and I thought...is th is it? The bartender was kind enough to let me know the main dining was upstairs main area. Went up the spiral stair aside the front of bar.  Going upstairs was a whole different view.  Needless to say Dante, our waiter, was the main reason for the enjoyable evening. He was well versed on the entire menu and the whole Catalonia experienxe. He even spoke some as well. He explained everything in detail. We tried so many things, and actually lingered on the Mesa a la Mercat charcuterie and cheese boards. Wow, they were so good. Then afterwards, so many things cane out including the gambas, which were so juicy. It was a smorgasbord of flavors and textures. I would be remiss if I did not mention the host. I don't know his name but he came back a few times to check on us. What a great guy and he is a connoisseur of Bourbons!!!  Almost the last people to exit,  Dante had us try the Catalonia dessert. We thought we were so full, but in the end, nothing was left of the dessert!  What a great experience dining at Mercat!
Chef's tasting menu is amazing.
Excellent scotch shots and a great compliment to the Spanish Meat trio app. Great bartender!
good food, great price and good service.
Had the taster menu option. Most dishes were vegetables or cheese. But great beef dish.
Tasty. Good, helpful service.
Good location, good food. An older crowd and not the trendy West Loop set, which I view as a feature and not a bug.
Good

I am from the Catalunya region in Spain and I can tell you 99% of the food served here is and tastes like at home amazing. Great price compared to other Chicago restaurants. But the food is even better.
My friend recommended this place
Best shrimp I've ever had in my life. Wow!  Every single tapaa i had was awesome, but the shrimp excelled!!!
Pricey but delicious!

Sadly the main restraunt was under construction when I visited so I didn't get to experience the whole ordeal but what I had I loved. I got several small tapas, including Chorizo, tater tots with aioli, prawns, and flat bread. the flat bread and chorizo were perfect. The tots and prawns were excellent but could have used a touch more sauce. The cheesecake for dessert was phenomenal. Will be back when it is open.
Is tapas the Spanish word for expensive?  In all seriousness, the food was pretty good.  Small portions though.
